channel.title: What game?
channel.description:
I just earned some money after working my ass off on sunday, and I was thinking about buying a new game.
So, should I buy Fallout 3 or wait and buy Infamous?

item.title: What game?
item.dc:creator: @LegendK1ll3r LegendK1ll3r
item.description:
@LegendK1ll3r wrote:

Having played both, I can easily say InFamous. I found nothing special about F.O.3, and although I own it, I just didn’t think it was nearly as good as Oblivion. I think it might just have to do with the setting, medieval times to me, is much more appealing than a desolate wasteland.

I clocked in about 20 hours so far on InFamous (playing as Good, on Hard), and still have 150+ shards to collect (I beat the game already on the good side, it was 20 hours clocked-in on getting everything besides the shards and beating the final boss on Hard). After I go and collect the rest of the shards I’m missing, I’m going to be doing a second play-through of the game just going at it as Evil Cole.

I’d like to see how drastically different the game plays out when comparing Good versus Evil. Supposedly, the game is much easier if you play the evil route, but I’ll have to see.

Either way, my pick is definitely for InFamous, you will get more than your money’s worth out of it.

Read full topic

item.title: What game?
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:21, topic:279249”]i guess, but do you compare portal and halflife?

meh im being a bit facaetious i guess, but i went into fallout expecting a cool rpg-like game that wasnt much like fallout 1/2 or the elder scrolls stuff, and i liked it. all the people that hated it seem to be oblivion fans who wanted another one of those or fallout 2 fans who wanted another one of those :p[/quote]
the only reason i hated it is the main story line, the idea of an RPG is to be able to do it and then carry on, i loved it up until the final part of the main story where you (cover your eyes children if you dont want to see what happens) have to choose between somebody dyeing and then the game ends and you cant carry on. That just ruined the game for me and just became an FPS instead of an RPG

Read full topic

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:11, topic:279249”][quote author=lordbost link=topic=368560.msg2790981#msg2790981 date=1242762426]
I already got fallout downloaded, but it don’t work, just crashes after i get on the menu.
After googling for a solution, it turns out lots of other have the exact same problem, so i have given up on finding a solution to that problem.
[/quote]

I had that problem too, but there is a fix for it and after applying that it works perfectly, give that a shot.[/quote]

Where can i find that fix?

item.title: What game?
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Man UTD Freak:

The game play looks amazing in Infamous when you watch the video but is it really that great? I mean, has anyone played this 1st hand? I am thinking of getting it but I want to know if it is really as good as it looks because there are always games which look good, but when you play them it doesn’t seem that way.

I agree especially with the latest generation consoles. I’ve been somewhat let down by most of the games I’ve played. A lot of them turn out really fun but nothing compares to the good old days of gaming.

Read full topic
